content: In the following questions, I will provide you with a graph (given as an array of nodes and an array of edges), a starting point, and a target point. Please return the shortest path from the starting point to the target point in the following format: 1->2->3->4... Please note that your answer should only include the result in this format and should not contain any other words.(Notice that for the same graph, if the start and end points of the problem are swapped, the new shortest path should be the reverse of the original shortest path.)

The shortest path from node 4 to node 7 in the given graph is:

1->2->7

Please note that for the same graph, if the start and end points of the problem are swapped, the new shortest path should be the reverse of the original shortest path. Therefore, if you change the start node to node 7 and the destination to node 4, the shortest path would be:

7->2->4

which is exactly the reverse of the path I provided above.

The shortest path from node 7 to node 4 in the given graph is:

7->2->4

This path involves the nodes 7, 2, and 4. Note that I've used the convention where the source node appears first and the destination node appears second. So in this case, node 7 is the source and node 4 is the destination.
